alert.note: Alert for Hartford (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 14 at 5:24AM EST until January 15 at 3:00AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Connecticut...Massachusetts...Rhode Island... Farmington River At Simsbury affecting Hartford County. Assabet River At Maynard affecting Middlesex and Worcester Counties. Pawtuxet River At Cranston affecting Providence and Kent Counties. Sudbury River At Saxonville affecting Middlesex County. Concord River At Lowell affecting Middlesex County. Charles River At Dover affecting Norfolk and Middlesex Counties. Pawcatuck River At Wood River Junction affecting Washington County. Pawcatuck River At Westerly affecting New London and Washington Counties. Taunton River Near Bridgewater affecting Bristol and Plymouth Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Rhode Island... Wood River At Hope Valley affecting Washington County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Connecticut...Massachusetts...New Hampshire... Connecticut River At Middle Haddam affecting Middlesex County. Nashua River At East Pepperell affecting Hillsborough, Middlesex and Worcester Counties. For the Farmington River...including Unionville, Simsbury, Tariffville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Assabet River...including Maynard...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Concord River...including Lowell...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Charles River...including Dover...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Pawtuxet River...including Scituate Reservoir, Cranston... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Pawcatuck River...including Wood River Junction, Westerly... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Taunton River...including Bridgewater...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Wood River...including Hope Valley...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Farmington River at Simsbury. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Flooding begins on Riverside Road in Simsbury. Flooding also begins along Old Bridge and Drake Hill Roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:32 AM EST Sunday the stage was 11.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early this morning to a crest of 12.2 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this morning at 630 AM EST.
